com.jgaap.generics
Class NearestNeighborDriver

java.lang.Object
  com.jgaap.generics.Parameterizable
      com.jgaap.generics.AnalysisDriver
          com.jgaap.generics.NearestNeighborDriver

public class NearestNeighborDriver
extends AnalysisDriver

Assigns authorship labels by using a nearest-neighbor approach on a given distance/divergence function.

analyze

public java.lang.String analyze(EventSet unknown,
                                java.util.Vector<EventSet> known)
Description copied from class: AnalysisDriver
Generic statistical analysis method (abstract). Analyze a given unknown EventSet in terms of its similarity (broadly defined) to elements of a Vector of EventSets of known authorship. Legacy code from WAY back. We should probably add a verify() method as well once the technology improves.

Specified by:
analyze in class AnalysisDriver
Parameters:
unknown - the EventSet to be analyzed
known - a vector of EventSets of known authorship
Returns:
a String representing the name of the author assigned

analyzeAverage

public java.lang.String analyzeAverage(EventSet unknown,
                                       java.util.Vector<EventSet> known)
Description copied from class: AnalysisDriver
Commutative statistical analysis method. Not all analytic methods are commutative (in particular, distance measures such as KL-divergence are known to give different results depending on whether you compare A to B, or B to A. Noncommutative methods may override this method to provide a method of enforcing commutivity in analysis.

Overrides:
analyzeAverage in class AnalysisDriver
Parameters:
unknown - the EventSet to be analyzed
known - a vector of EventSets of known authorship
Returns:
a String representing the name of the author assigned
